intro: Hedyotis leptoneura, commonly known as the slender-stemmed inchplant, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant typically grows as a low, creeping perennial with small, opposite leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. Its botanical features include slender stems, lanceolate leaves, and small, tubular flowers that are often arranged in cymes. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
